name: Thunderous
description:
Moonwalk through the skies, and tear them asunder.

210 MB Google Docs link (itch link is 1GB, size difference due to reduced textures, and general debug; ALL gameplay/graphics b/w the two are virtually identical):

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1E8W15EDwVqO2w_t6pi45FMHLvAP16ENF/view?usp=sharing

RATE MY GAME AND I RATE YOURS (within 24h). 

There's a small respawn movement bug, solved by landing and flying again.

This game is mainly a combat simulation test in an attempt to blend 3D flight with 3D movement with planet gravity. Your lightning strikes/storms cover a massive area across the procedurally generated planets, so the fast enemies should be manageable after you get used to the controls. The funkiest controls are:

Space: blast off in the direction the camera is facing.

Character automatically tries to fly toward the camera direction. Arrow keys during flight to quickly roll/boost in that direction.

LMB: throw lightning. RMB: summon a storm in front of you (only works when near clouds). There's a few hidden combat mechanics aka rotate view while summoning the storm to cover a larger area, boosting during attack animations, etc.

Update 1, 2, and 3: Decreased size from 1.2 GB to 220 MB by deleting unused assets and reducing texture size (graphics change is negligible). Fixed major bugs and lag. Runs on my 1080 Ti at 80 FPS all day on Ultra.

Update 4 (planned): Add credits.
